result.execSummary:
The defendant Tara L Mlejnek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/01/2016 or penalty of 3 days Huber for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tara L Mlejnek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Tara L Mlejnek did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend count #1 to a county ordinance.  Attorney Morin enters a no contest plea on behalf of her client.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  
Court orders the following:  Count #1. 
FORFEITURE:  $389.50 to be paid at a rate of $25.00 a month commencing 11/1/2016.  Failure to pay will result in 3 days huber.
